metadata.title: CVE-2014-6422 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The SDP dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.10 creates duplicatehashtables for a media channel, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet to the RTPdissector.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6422` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
